News.Title: Avanti Feeds Q3FY26 Net Profit Rises 16.02% YoY
News.Summary: Avanti Feeds reports consolidated net profit of Rs 16,347.35 lakhs for Q3FY26, up 16.02% YoY. Revenue from operations increased 1.31% to Rs 1,38,352.27 lakhs despite quarterly challenges.

News.Title: Avanti Feeds Board Meet Set for Feb 11 to Review Q3 Results
News.Summary: Avanti Feeds Limited has scheduled a board meeting on February 11, 2026, to consider and approve Q3FY26 standalone and consolidated unaudited financial results for the quarter ended December 31, 2025.

News.Title: Avanti Feeds surges 8% on Trump trade deal hopes
News.Summary: Export-oriented stocks including Avanti Feeds rallied up to 8% after Trump's positive comments on India-US trade deal to Moneycontrol, boosting shrimp and textile companies.

News.Title: Export stocks rally on US trade deal hopes
News.Summary: Avanti Feeds, Gokaldas Exports, and other export-oriented stocks surged to day's high after US Ambassador Sergio Gor's positive comments on India-US trade negotiations, recovering from last week's tariff-related losses.

News.Title: Avanti Feeds Reports Mixed Q2 FY26 Results with Strong Shrimp Processing Growth Amid US Tariff Challenges
News.Summary: Avanti Feeds posted consolidated gross income of INR 1,659 crores in Q2 FY26 with PBT at INR 227 crores, while shrimp processing division showed strong 62% YoY growth to INR 462 crores despite US tariff pressures. The company expects feed margins to compress to 9-10% due to rising raw material costs, with fishmeal prices increasing to INR 125 per kg and soybean meal to INR 47 per kg, while maintaining feed sales guidance of 575,000 MT for FY26.

News.Title: Avanti Feeds Reports Strong Growth with 19% Revenue Rise and Expansion Plans
News.Summary: Avanti Feeds reported consolidated revenue growth of 19% YoY to ₹16,097 million with PAT increasing 39%, while expanding feed capacity and automation at Andhra and Gujarat units. The company targets 12-14% EBITDA margins and 15% CAGR over the next 3 years, focusing on multi-year growth in aquafeed and shrimp processing segments with strong export momentum expected.

News.Title: Avanti Feeds Reports 36% Jump in Quarterly Profit to Rs 169 Crore
News.Summary: Avanti Feeds Limited reported a consolidated net profit of Rs 168.79 crore for the quarter ended September 30, 2025, compared to Rs 121.48 crore in the same period last year, marking a 38.9% increase. Revenue from operations rose to Rs 160.97 crore from Rs 135.23 crore year-on-year. On a standalone basis, the company posted a net profit of Rs 135.05 crore versus Rs 106.46 crore in the previous year quarter. The company's board approved contributing Euro 10,000 towards subscription to issued capital of its wholly owned subsidiary Sealuxe B.V., Netherlands, and extending an unsecured loan of Euro 40,000 to the subsidiary for meeting initial revenue expenditures. Earnings per share increased to Rs 11.25 from Rs 8.34 on a consolidated basis.

News.Title: Avanti Feeds Reports Strong Q2 Performance with 35% Jump in Net Profit
News.Summary: Avanti Feeds delivered robust quarterly results with consolidated net profit rising to 1.53 billion rupees from 1.13 billion rupees year-over-year. Revenue increased to 16.09 billion rupees compared to 13.52 billion rupees in the same period last year. EBITDA grew to 1.94 billion rupees from 1.35 billion rupees, while EBITDA margin improved to 12.07% from 10.04% year-over-year.

News.Title: Indian Shrimp Exporters Surge Up to 12% on US Trade Deal Optimism
News.Summary: Shares of Indian shrimp feed exporters rallied significantly, with Avanti Feeds gaining 6%, Apex Frozen Foods up 9%, and Coastal Corporation hitting a 20% circuit limit. The surge followed reports that India and the US are nearing a trade agreement that would reduce US tariffs on Indian imports from 50% to 15-16%. US President Donald Trump confirmed discussions with Prime Minister Narendra Modi focusing on trade and energy, with Modi reportedly agreeing to limit oil purchases from Russia. The US represents a crucial market for these companies - Avanti Feeds derives 77% of revenue from North America while Apex Frozen Foods gets 53% from the US. Current US tariffs have pushed total duties on Indian seafood exports to nearly 60%, making exports largely unviable. India exported $7.45 billion worth of seafood in 2024-25, with the US accounting for $2.71 billion, up from $2.55 billion in 2023-24.

News.Title: Avanti Feeds Incorporates Wholly Owned Subsidiary SEALUXE B.V. in Netherlands
News.Summary: Avanti Feeds Limited incorporated a wholly owned subsidiary named SEALUXE B.V. in the Netherlands on October 20, 2025. The subsidiary will operate in the seafood industry and Avanti Feeds holds 100% shareholding through share subscription at a par value of 10 Euros per share. The newly incorporated company is proposed to be engaged in seafood business but has not yet commenced business operations.

News.Title: Avanti Feeds Approves Netherlands Subsidiary and Windmill Asset Sale Worth Rs 2.4 Crores
News.Summary: Avanti Feeds' board approved the incorporation of a wholly owned subsidiary in the Netherlands, European Union. The company also approved the sale of 4 windmills with a total capacity of 3.20 MW after completion of 20 years and expiry of the Power Purchase Agreement with BESCOM, Karnataka. The windmill division generated revenue of Rs 1.63 crores, contributing 0.0367% of consolidated turnover and 0.37% of total net worth as of March 31, 2025. The expected realisable value from the windmill sale is approximately Rs 2.4 crores excluding taxes, with completion targeted by March 2026. The company will identify potential buyers and execute sale agreements in due course.

News.Title: Frozen Shrimp Leads India's Seafood Exports at $5.17 Billion with US and China as Top Markets
News.Summary: Frozen shrimp dominates India's seafood export sector, generating $5.17 billion in revenue. The product accounts for 43.67% of total seafood export quantity and represents 69.46% of total dollar earnings from seafood exports. The United States and China serve as the leading import markets for Indian seafood products.

News.Title: Frozen Shrimp Dominates India's Seafood Exports at $5.17 Billion
News.Summary: Frozen shrimp leads India's seafood export sector with revenues of $5.17 billion, representing 43.67% of export quantity and 69.46% of total seafood export revenue. The United States and China serve as the primary importing markets for Indian frozen shrimp exports.

News.Title: Indian Government Negotiates with Japan, China, and UK to Counter Trump's 50% Seafood Export Duty
News.Summary: The Indian government is actively negotiating with Japan, China, and the UK to boost seafood exports in response to Trump's 50% duty impact on the sector. These diplomatic efforts aim to address tariff challenges affecting companies like Avanti Feeds and the broader Indian seafood export industry.

News.Title: Avanti Feeds Reports Strong Q1 Performance with 34% Jump in EBITDA
News.Summary: Avanti Feeds delivered robust quarterly results with EBITDA rising to 2.14 billion rupees from 1.6 billion rupees year-over-year. The company's EBITDA margin expanded to 13.33% compared to 10.63% in the same period last year. Consolidated net profit increased to 1.78 billion rupees from 1.3 billion rupees year-over-year. Revenue grew to 16 billion rupees from 15 billion rupees in the previous year period.

News.Title: Avanti Feeds Faces $2 Billion Shrimp Export Issues Due to Tariff Increases
News.Summary: Avanti Feeds is experiencing significant challenges with shrimp exports valued at $2 billion due to tariff increases. A seafood export group has requested immediate financial support to address these export-related issues affecting the company's operations.

News.Title: Indian Shrimp Exporters Face Impact from Trump's 25% Tariff Announcement
News.Summary: Donald Trump announced that India will face a 25% tariff along with an unspecified penalty for doing business with Russia. This development puts focus on Indian shrimp feed exporters including Avanti Feeds, Waterbase, and Apex Frozen Foods, as the US represents a major market for these companies. Avanti Feeds derived 77% of revenue from North America in the March quarter, while Apex Frozen Foods generated 53% of revenue from the United States. India holds 20% of the global shrimp market share with nearly 48% of Indian shrimp exports going to the US market. Current Indian shrimp exports to the US face 17.7% effective customs duty, which would increase to 25% under the new tariff structure. Recent stock performance shows Avanti Feeds down 6% and Waterbase down 3.3% over the past month.

News.Title: Avanti Feeds: Q4 Profit Surges 40%, Margin Improves
News.Summary: Avanti Feeds reported a 39.6% YoY increase in Q4 consolidated net profit to Rs 157 crore. Revenue grew 7.9% to Rs 1,385 crore. EBITDA jumped 36.4% to Rs 176.7 crore, with margin improving to 12.76%. The board recommended a final dividend of Rs 9 per share for FY25.

News.Title: Avanti Feeds Reports Q4 Financial Results and Dividend Announcement
News.Summary: Avanti Feeds has reported its Q4 consolidated net profit at 1.52 billion rupees, compared to 1.04 billion rupees year-over-year and 1.35 billion rupees quarter-over-quarter. The company's Q4 revenue stood at 13.85 billion rupees, up from 12.8 billion rupees in the same quarter last year. Additionally, Avanti Feeds has recommended a dividend of 9 rupees per equity share.

News.Title: Avanti Feeds Reports Q4 Results and Recommends Dividend
News.Summary: Avanti Feeds announced its Q4 financial results and dividend recommendation. The company's Q4 consolidated net profit increased to 1.52 billion rupees from 1.04 billion rupees year-over-year. Revenue rose to 13.85 billion rupees from 12.8 billion rupees. EBITDA improved to 1.77 billion rupees with a margin of 12.76%, up from 1.3 billion rupees and 10.09% margin in the previous year. The company has recommended a dividend of 9 rupees per equity share.

News.Title: Avanti Feeds: Q4 Profit Surges 40%, ₹9 Dividend Declared
News.Summary: Avanti Feeds reported a 39.6% YoY increase in Q4 consolidated net profit to ₹157 crore. Revenue grew 7.9% to ₹1,385 crore. EBITDA jumped 36.4% to ₹176.7 crore with margins improving to 12.76%. The company declared a final dividend of ₹9 per share for FY25.

News.Title: PM Modi Reviews Fisheries Sector, Focusing on Deep Sea Fishing and Exports
News.Summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi chaired a meeting to review the fisheries sector in India, with a particular emphasis on deep sea fishing and seafood exports. This indicates the government's interest in developing and potentially expanding these areas of the fishing industry.

News.Title: Avanti Feeds: Penny Stock Soars to ₹830, Delivering 54,505% Return in 15 Years
News.Summary: Avanti Feeds stock has risen from ₹1.52 to ₹830 over 15 years, yielding a 54,505% return. The company reported an 86.5% YoY increase in Q3 FY25 net profit to ₹135.2 crore, with revenue up 9% to ₹1,365.8 crore. EBITDA grew 65.4% YoY to ₹160.4 crore, with margins expanding to 11.7%.

News.Title: Avanti Feeds Reports Significant Increase in Q3 Consolidated Net Profit
News.Summary: Avanti Feeds Limited has announced its financial results for the third quarter, reporting a consolidated net profit of 1.35 billion rupees. This represents a substantial increase from the 725 million rupees reported in the same quarter of the previous year, indicating a year-over-year growth of approximately 86%.

News.Title: Avanti Feeds Reports Significant Growth in Q3 EBITDA and Margin
News.Summary: Avanti Feeds has announced its Q3 financial results, showing substantial year-over-year improvements. The company's EBITDA increased from 970 million rupees to 1.60 billion rupees. Additionally, the EBITDA margin expanded from 7.74% to 11.74%, indicating enhanced operational efficiency and profitability.

News.Title: Avanti Feeds Reports Q3 Revenue Increase
News.Summary: Avanti Feeds Limited has reported a revenue of 13.7 billion rupees for the third quarter, showing an increase from 12.5 billion rupees in the same quarter of the previous year.

News.Title: Avanti Feeds to Consider Q3 Results
News.Summary: Avanti Feeds Limited has announced that it will consider its financial results for the third quarter on February 10. This indicates the company is preparing to disclose its performance for the most recent fiscal period to shareholders and the public.

News.Title: Avanti Feeds: Q2 Profit Soars 53%, Revenue Up 6%
News.Summary: Avanti Feeds reported a 53.2% YoY increase in Q2 FY25 net profit to ₹113.7 crore. Revenue rose 6% to ₹1,355 crore. EBITDA grew 44.3% to ₹135.6 crore, with margins improving from 7.4% to 10%.
